Moo::RenderContext

Moo::RenderContext Class Reference

This class creates and manages the d3d device, backbuffer etc, it's the current state of rendering in that it contains the current lights, matrices, lod state, zoom factor and so forth. More...

#include <render_context.hpp>

Detailed Description

This class creates and manages the d3d device, backbuffer etc, it's the current state of rendering in that it contains the current lights, matrices, lod state, zoom factor and so forth.

Anything that is of global importance to rendering should be contained in the render context.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

The render contexts constructor, prepares to create a dx device, and sets default values.

Destruct render context.

const D3DSURFACE_DESC & Moo::RenderContext::backBufferDesc (  )  const

uint32 Moo::RenderContext::backBufferWidthOverride (  )  const

void Moo::RenderContext::backBufferWidthOverride ( uint32  backBufferWidthOverride  ) 

This function overrides the dimensions of the back buffer when in windowed mode using a given width.

Given values are first clamped to the maximum width supported by the device. The height is set so as to maintain the aspect ratio of the front buffer. A value of 0 means that this feature is disabled and the back buffer will have the same dimensions as the front. This functionality can be used to produce screenshots at resolutions greater than that that can be displayed on a monitor.

Parameters:
backBufferWidthOverride Width to set the back buffer to. 0 indicates same width as the visible display.

bool Moo::RenderContext::changeMode ( uint32  modeIndex,
bool  windowed,
bool  testCooperative = false,
uint32  backBufferWidthOverride = 0 
)

This method changes the current display mode or windowed/fullscreen mode on the current device.

Parameters:
modeIndex is the index of the displaymode to choose.
windowed tells the rendercontext whether to use windowed mode or not.
testCooperative if true, tests the device's cooperative level before changing the mode. The mode is not changed if the device is lost.
backBufferWidthOverride Width to set the back buffer to. 0 indicates same width as the visible display.
Returns:
true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

bool Moo::RenderContext::checkDevice ( bool *  reset = NULL  ) 

This method checks the device's cooperative level.

It returns true if the device is operational. If it has been lost, it tries to reset it, returning true if successful. It returns false if the device was lost cannot be reset immediatly. CRITICAL_MSG will be triggered if the device has entered an unrecoverable state.

Parameters:
reset set to true if the device was reset.
Returns:
true if device is operational, false otherwise.

bool Moo::RenderContext::checkDeviceYield ( bool *  reset = NULL  ) 

Tests the cooperative level of the device, seizing control if the device has been lost.

In this case, starts retesting the device cooperative level, at a fixed time intervals, until it can be reset. When that finally happens, resets the device and returns true.

Messages requesting the application to close will make the function return false. All Other messages are translated and dispatched to the registered WinProc function.

CRITICAL_MSG will be triggered if the device enters an unrecoverable state.

Parameters:
reset set to true if the device was reset.
Returns:
true if device is operational. False if a WM_QUIT message or ALT+F4 key event has been intercepted.

void Moo::RenderContext::clearBindings (  ) 

Clears the currently bound device resources.

It is D3D recommended behaviour to unbind all resource states after every frame.

bool Moo::RenderContext::createDevice ( HWND  hWnd,
uint32  deviceIndex = 0,
uint32  modeIndex = 0,
bool  windowed = true,
bool  requireStencil = false,
const Vector2 &  windowedSize = Vector2(0, 0),
bool  hideCursor = true,
bool  forceRef = false,
bool  useWrapper = false 
)

Creates the d3d device and binds it to a window.

Parameters:
hWnd is the windowhandle to bind the d3d device to.
deviceIndex is the index of the device to create.
modeIndex is the index of the displaymode to initialise.
windowed says whether to create a windowed or fullscreen device.
requireStencil says whether a stencil buffer is required.
windowedSize windowed size.
hideCursor says whether the cursor should be hidden.
forceRef Boolean indicating whether to force the Direct3D software reference rasteriser.
Returns:
true if the operation was successful.

void Moo::RenderContext::getNearPlaneRect ( Vector3 &  corner,
Vector3 &  xAxis,
Vector3 &  yAxis 
) const

This method returns the rectangle that is the intersection of the near-plane with the view frustum.

Parameters:
corner The position of the bottom-left corner of the rectangle.
xAxis The length of the horizontal edges.
yAxis The length of the vertical edges.
Note:
The invView matrix must be correct before this method is called. You may need to call updateViewTransforms.
See also:
invView

updateViewTransforms

void Moo::RenderContext::postMultiply ( const Matrix &  m  ) 

This method multiplies the world matrix by the input ( world * m ).

void Moo::RenderContext::preloadDeviceResources ( uint32  timeLimitMs  ) 

This method preloads resources from the preloadlist.

It spends up to timeLimit time doing this

Parameters:
timeLimitMs the max time in milliseconds we want to spend on preloading

void Moo::RenderContext::preMultiply ( const Matrix &  m  ) 

This method multiplies the input by the world matrix ( m * world ).

void Moo::RenderContext::reset ( const Matrix &  m  ) 

This method resets the world matrix to the supplied matrix and the world matrix stack.

Parameters:
m the matrix to reset the world matrix to.

void Moo::RenderContext::reset (  ) 

This method resets the world matrix to identity and the world matrix stack.

bool Moo::RenderContext::resetDevice (  ) 

This method resets the device to the exact same current modeIndex and windowed mode.

Use it whenever the underlying window is resized to adjust the size of the frame buffers.

void Moo::RenderContext::restoreCursor ( bool  state  ) 

Restores the windows cursor state, hidding or showing it depending on the value passed.

Parameters:
state True will show the windows cursor. False will hide it.

const std::string Moo::RenderContext::screenShot ( const std::string &  fileExt = "bmp",
const std::string &  fileName = "shot",
bool  autoNumber = true 
)

Takes a screenshot.

Parameters:
fileExt - the extension to save the screenshot as, this can be "bmp", "jpg", "tga", "png" or "dds".
fileName - the root name of the file to save out
autoNumber - is this is true then try to postpend a unique identifying number to the shot name(e.g. shot_666.bmp)
